sen.j: 四所駅（ししょえき）は、京都府舞鶴市上福井にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道(KTR)北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Kamifukui, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, Shisho Station is a stop on the Yiayzu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Shisho Station, located in Kamifukui, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Yiayzu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
Shisho Station, located in Kamifukui, Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 普通列車のみ停車する。
sen.e: Only local trains stop at this station.
Only local trains stop at this station.
Only local trains stop at this station.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面2線を有する。
sen.e: This station is provided with two platforms with two tracks served between them.
The station is provided with two platforms with two tracks served between them.
The station is provided with two platforms with two tracks served between them.

sen.j: 駅舎はこの付近に関所があったことから、関所をイメージしたデザインとなっている。
sen.e: A checking station, where the persons going to pass through the station were checked by govermental officers in older days, once existed around this station, and the station house is designed imaging a checking station.

A checking station, where in older days persons about to pass through the station were checked by governmental officers, once existed around this station, and the station house is designed in a style reminiscent of a checking station.

A checking station, where in older days persons about to pass through the station were checked by governmental officers, once existed around this station, and the station house is designed in a style reminiscent of a checking station.

sen.j: 駅舎には便所と待合室が設置されている。
sen.e: A lavatory and waiting room are provided in the station house.
A lavatory and waiting room are provided in the station house.
A lavatory and waiting room are provided in the station house.

sen.j: 無人駅。
sen.e: This station is unmanned.
The station is unmanned.
The station is unmanned.

sen.j: また、一線スルーになっていて、当駅通過列車は速度制限を受けることなく通過できるようになっている。
sen.e: So-called one "through" track structure* is used to enable the trains passing through this station to run without decreasing their train speeds (* one track alone of a station is structured mostly straightly for trains passing through the station (to be used by both up- and down- trains)).

A so-called "through" track structure* is used to enable trains passing through this station to run without decreasing their speeds (* one of the station's tracks is generally straight for the convenience of up and down trains passing through the station).

A so-called "through" track structure* is used to enable trains passing through this station to run without decreasing their speeds (* one of the station's tracks is generally straight for the convenience of inbound and outbound trains passing through the station).
sen.cmt: 上り、下り→inbound, outbound としました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 大庄屋 上野家住宅（西方寺地区）
sen.e: A big Shoya house: Ueno (a village headman) family 's house (located in the Saihoji area)
A big Shoya house: The family house of a Ueno (a village headman) (located in the Saihoji area)
A big Shoya house: The family house of a Ueno (a village headman) (located in the Saihoji area)

sen.j: 江戸後期に建てられた茅葺き屋根の家を、観光拠点として改修し、利用している施設、要予約だが、各種体験も出来る。
sen.e: This thached house built in the later era of the Edo period has been repaired and used as a sight-seeing site; Making a reservation is necessary to visit the house, but you can participate in various activites prepared there.

This thatched house, built late in the Edo period has been repaired and used as a tourist spot; reservations to see the house are easily made, and visitors can participate in various activities there.
This thatched house, built late in the Edo period has been repaired and used as a tourist spot; reservations to see the house is required, and visitors can participate in various activities there.
sen.cmt: 要予約 を追加しました。

sen.j: ふじつ温泉（徒歩約10分または京都交通 (舞鶴)バス利用10分）
sen.e: Fujitu-onsen Hot Spring (about ten minitues on foot or ten minutes by using a bus of Kyoto Kotsu (Maizuru) Bus form this station
Fujitu-onsen Hot Spring (about ten minutes on foot or ten minutes via a Kyoto Kotsu (Maizuru) bus from the station)
Fujitu-onsen Hot Spring (about ten minutes on foot or ten minutes via a Kyoto Kotsu (Maizuru) bus from the station)

sen.j: 舞鶴港とれとれセンター（当駅下車・徒歩または京都交通バス利用で、10分）
sen.e: Toretore Center at Maizuru Port (get off at this station, and walk or ride a bus of Kyoto Kotsu Bus for 10 minutes).
Toretore Center at Maizuru Port: Get off at this station, then either walk or ride a bus of Kyoto Kotsu Bus for 10 minutes.
Toretore Center at Maizuru Port: Get off at this station, then either walk or ride a bus of Kyoto Kotsu Bus for 10 minutes.

sen.j: 喜多工業団地
sen.e: Kita Industrial Park
Kita Industrial Park
Kita Industrial Park

sen.j: 岡田地区
sen.e: The Okada area
The Okada area
The Okada area

sen.j: 国道175号
sen.e: National highway 175
National Highway 175
National Route 175

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Use situations
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約14人である。
sen.e: The number of persons getting on board at this station is approx. 14 a day in the fiscal 2006.
In fiscal 2006, the average daily number of persons getting on board at this station was 14.
In fiscal year 2006, the average daily number of persons getting on board at this station was 14.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (From statistics of Kyoto Prefecture)
(From statistics of Kyoto Prefecture)
(According to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report)
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年）4月12日 - 日本国有鉄道峰山線の駅として開業。
sen.e: April 12, 1924 - This station started its operation as a stop on the Mineyam Line, which was operated by apanese National Railways.
April 12, 1924: This station started its operation as a stop on the Mineyama Line, which was operated by Japanese National Railways.
April 12, 1924: This station started its operation as a stop on the Mineyama Line, which was operated by Japanese National Railways.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - Due to the division and privitization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
April 1, 1987: Due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways, it became a station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日 - 北近畿タンゴ鉄道に転換。
sen.e: April 1, 1990 - Its ownership was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway.
April 1, 1990: Its ownership was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway.
April 1, 1990: Its ownership was transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）3月29日 - 現在の駅舎が竣工。
sen.e: March 29, 1996 - The construction of the present station house was completed.
March 29, 1996: The construction of the present station house was completed.
March 29, 1996: The construction of the present station house was completed.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道
sen.e: Kitakinki Tango Railway
Kitakinki Tango Railway
Kitakinki Tango Railway

sen.e: Miyazu Line
Miyazu Line

sen.j: 西舞鶴駅 - 四所駅 - 東雲駅 (京都府)
